channel.title: CVE Feed for NetHack -- NetHack
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NetHack -- NetHack

item.title: CVE-2020-5210|2024-08-04T08:22:08.904Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, an invalid argument to the -w command line option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to influence command line options. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5214|2024-08-04T08:22:08.719Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, detecting an unknown configuration file option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to upload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5213|2024-08-04T08:22:08.960Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, too long of a value for the SYMBOL configuration file option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to upload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5253|2024-08-04T08:22:09.098Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: NetHack before version 3.6.0 allowed malicious use of escaping of characters in the configuration file (usually .nethackrc) which could be exploited. This bug is patched in NetHack 3.6.0.

item.title: CVE-2020-5212|2024-08-04T08:22:08.776Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, an extremely long value for the MENUCOLOR configuration file option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to upload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5211|2024-08-04T08:22:08.819Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, an invalid extended command in value for the AUTOCOMPLETE configuration file option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to upload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5209|2024-08-04T08:22:08.881Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, unknown options starting with -de and -i can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to influence command line options. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

item.title: CVE-2020-5254|2024-08-04T08:22:09.084Z -- nethack -- nethack
item.description: In NetHack before 3.6.6, some out-of-bound values for the hilite_status option can be exploited. NetHack 3.6.6 resolves this issue.
